org.orgName: Northern Division District Court of Washington

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the Northern District of Washington.
In the Matter of the Application of D.A. Hatfield for a writ of Habeas Corpus.
The said petitioner, D.A. Hatfield, most respectfully shows to said above entitled court, and to the Hon. C. H. Hanford, one of the Judges thereof, as follows:

That your said petitioner, D.A. Hatfield, is unjustly, wrongfully and illegally deprived of his lib erty by Robert Hodge, as sheriff and ex-officio jailer of King county, Washington, and is unlawfully confined in the jail of King county, Washington, in the City of Seattle, King county, Washington, by the said Robert Hodge, aforesaid, without due process of law and in controvention of the fifth amendment to the consitution of the United States.
That the cause of such illegal imprisonment and detention as aforesaid is as follows:

That about June 16th, 1911, your petitioner was informed against by the prosecuting attorney in and for King county, Washington, by an information duly signed, verified and filed in words and figures as follows:
In the superior court of the state of Washington,
For King County, State of Washington, Plaintiff, -vs- D.A. Hatfield and George W. Workman, Defendants. } No. 5880.
Information.

I, John F. Murphy, prosecuting Attorney in and for the county of King, State of Washington, come now here in the name of and by the authority of the state of Washington and by this information 1
do accuse D.A. Hatfield and George W. Workman, and each of them, of the crime of attempting to escape from prison, committed as follows, towit:

He, said D.A. Hatfield in the county of King, State of Washington on the 12th day of May, 1911, was confined and held in a prison, to wit, the King County jail, located in the city of Seattle, in said county and state, on a charge, conviction, and sentence of felony, towit, forgery in the first degree, theretofore duly made, rendered and impored against him in cause numbered 5589 in the superior court of the state of Washington for King county, asn was then and there confined and held in said prison on a charge of felony, towit, forgery in the first degree, theretofore duly made against him in cause numbered 5622 in said superior court, and he, said George W. Workman was then and there confined and held in said prison on a charge, conviction and sentence of felony, towit, carnal knowledge of a child, duly made rendered and imposed against him in cause numbered 5779 in said superior court. And they, said D.A. Hatfield and George W. Workman, and each of them, while then and there being so confined and held in said prison, did then and there wilfully, unlawfully and feloniously and by force, attempt to escape from said prison by obtaining from outside said prison, through means which are to the prosecuting attorney unknown, acid, saws and blow pipe, and by then and there using and attempting to use said acid blow pipe and saws in sawing and cutting the iron bolts and bars of said prison, for the purpose of making an aperture therein, through or by means of which they, or either of them might escape.
Contrary to the state in such case made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the state of Washington.
State of Washington, County of King, }ss

Hugh M. Caldwell, being first duly sworn, on oath says that he is deputy prosecuting attorney in and for the county of King, state of Washington; that he has read the foregoing information, knows the contents thereof, and believes the same to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 16th day of June, 1911.
div1.ab: D.K. Sickles, Clerk Superior Court of King county, State of Washington, by W.K. Sickles, Deputy.
div1.p: Witnesses for the state: Robert T. Hodge Allen Stark. L.P. VanBlaricon.
Filed June 16th, 1911,

That thereafter, your petitioner was duly tried on said charge attempted to be set forth in said information and was found guilty by a jury and thereafter was sentenced by said superior court to be confined in the pententiary of the state of Washington, for a period of not less than two years, which said judgment and sentence was sustained and affirmed by the Supreme Court of the state of Washington, and the said Robert T. Hodge, Sheriff and jailer as aforesaid threatens to deliever your petitioner to the agents of the state of Washington, for the purpose of convaying him to the pententiary at Walla Walla. That if there is any other legal cause of the dentention and imprisonment of your petitioner than that set 3
forth, your Petitioner is not informed thereof, but if there is any other cause of detention, the same is unjust and unlawful.
That the illegality of said unlawful imprisonment and detention as claimed by your petitioner herein may be more particularly state and described, as follows:

That siad infromation attempting to charge your petitioner with the offense of attempted escape from prison does not state or charge a crime against the laws of the state of Washington, and is null and void and cannot become the basis of a valid judgment for the reason that that the said information fails to show that that at the time of the commission of the alleged pretended offense, your petitioner was in lawful custody, and fails to show that your petitioner was imprisoned by virtue of a written committment. That under our system of criminal jurisprudence "no person can be deprived o his liberty on accounty of some" "criminal charge against him except by virtue of some written" "Written authority therefor, except in causes where the accused may" "be arrested before any warrant has been issued. But even in cases" "where the accused may be arrested withour warrant, he must be immediately" "taken before a maristrate, and a complaint filed against" "him, and a warrant issued wherewith to hold him, or the custody" "of him would become unlawful."
Wherefore, your Petitioner prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus be issued herein and that upon a hearing thereon, your Petitioner be discharged.
div1.ab: AJ McBride Atty for Petitioner 406 Eplor Block Tel. Francis 2114.
div1.p: State of Washington, County of King, SS.

D.A. Hatfield, who being duly sworn on his oath says he is the Petitioner named in the within and foregoing petition for a writ of Habeas Corpus; That he has read the same and knows the contents thereof, and that the allegations and statements therein contained are true in substance and in fact.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this Fifth dat of Feburary, 1912.
div1.ab: James E. McGraw Notary Public for the state of Washington, residing at Seattle.
